item.title: 土耳其警察向反对派总部外发射催泪瓦斯
item.description: 周一，土耳其防暴警察向主要反对党伊斯坦布尔总部外的抗议者施放催泪瓦斯，政治僵局愈演愈烈。【原文：Turkish riot police used tear gas on protesters outside the main opposition party’s Istanbul headquarters on Monday, amid a mounting political standoff.】

item.title: 票务平台 StubHub 在美国首次公开募股中募集 8.51 亿美元
item.description: 门票销售平台 StubHub 控股公司正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集高达 8.51 亿美元的资金。【原文：Ticket selling platform StubHub Holdings Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $851 million in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 智利消费者价格在关键利率会议前夕保持稳定
item.description: 在智利央行行长开会确定基准利率的前一天公布的一份报告显示，智利上个月的消费价格没有变化。【原文：Chile’s consumer prices were unchanged last month, according to a report published one day before central bankers meet to set the benchmark interest rate.】

item.title: 网络安全公司 Netskope 寻求 IPO 筹资 8.13 亿美元
item.description: 云安全服务提供商 Netskope 公司正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集高达 8.13 亿美元的资金，因为各家公司都在抢滩接近历史高点的美国股票市场。【原文：Netskope Inc., a cloud security provider, is seeking to raise as much as $813 million in an initial public offering, as companies rush to tap a US equity market that’s nearing record highs.】

item.title: Planet Labs 因需求增加而更快完成交易，业绩大幅增长
item.description: 由于对地球成像公司数据的需求增加，Planet Labs PBC 提高了全年销售额预期。【原文：Planet Labs PBC boosted its full-year sales forecast amid higher demand for the earth-imaging company’s data.】

item.title: 特斯拉投资者争论是否向 xAI 抛出救命稻草
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，埃德-鲁德洛（Ed Ludlow）将探讨埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能公司 xAI 与他的汽车制造商特斯拉（Tesla）之间环环相扣的关系。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow looks at the interlocking relationship between Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence firm, xAI, and his carmaker, Tesla.】

item.title: 苹果公司斥资 4,500 亿美元打造的产品发布会面临质疑
item.description: 投资者期望苹果公司今年最重要的产品发布会能成为其最近复苏的股价的下一个催化剂，但他们很可能会失望而归。【原文：Investors expecting Apple Inc.’s biggest product event of the year to serve as the next catalyst for its recently-revived stock are likely to come away disappointed.】

item.title: 法国今天又将失去一位总理
item.description: 我是克雷格-斯特林，法兰克福资深经济编辑。今天我们将关注 William Horobin 关于法国财政混乱的报道。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Craig Stirling, a senior economics editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at William Horobin’s reporting on France’s fiscal mess. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 关税是如何破坏美国经济增长的？
item.description: 周五公布的美国就业数据延续了 7 月份就业增长乏力和前几个月就业数据大幅修正的趋势。8 月份仅增加了 22,000 个工作岗位，劳动力再次出乎预测者的意料，出现了下滑。修订后的 6 月份数据表明，这是自科维德大流行以来的首次月度萎缩。【原文：Friday’s release of US jobs data continued a trend that emerged with July’s weak employment growth and significant revisions for prior months. With just 22,000 jobs added in August, the labor force again surprised forecasters on the downside. Revised June numbers pointed to the first monthly contraction since the Covid pandemic.】

item.title: 小型 SPAC 与量子公司 Infleqtion 达成 18 亿美元交易
item.description: 量子计算公司 Infleqtion 已同意与迈克尔-克莱因（Michael Klein）领导的一家空白支票公司合并，该协议为这家初创公司带来了 18 亿美元的融资前估值。【原文：Quantum computing firm Infleqtion has agreed to merge with a blank-check firm led by Michael Klein in a pact that gives the startup a pre-money valuation of $1.8 billion.】

item.title: 米莱在布宜诺斯艾利斯投票中落败导致阿根廷债券暴跌
item.description: 由于哈维尔-米莱伊总统在一次关键的省级选举中落败，加深了人们对其经济议程能否获得政治支持的担忧，阿根廷美元债券周一下挫。【原文：Argentina’s dollar bonds sank on Monday as President Javier Milei’s defeat in a key provincial election deepened concerns around political support for his economic agenda.】

item.title: 债券市场与 "财政困难 "国家
item.description:
日本、法国和英国的政治动荡又增加了一层风险。【原文：

Political flux in Japan, France and the UK is adding an extra layer of risk. 

】

item.title: 社交媒体禁令引发抗议，尼泊尔发生致命冲突
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，尼泊尔加德满都发生了抗议政府禁止多个社交媒体平台的示威活动，造成至少 14 人死亡，数十人受伤。【原文：At least fourteen people were killed and dozens injured in Nepal’s Kathmandu during protests against the government’s decision to ban several social media platforms, local media reported.】

item.title: PAG 的 Nuvama 股权出售案被指因简街案而放缓
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在印度股市监管机构对 Jane Street Group 展开调查后，亚洲私募股权公司 PAG 可能出售 Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd. 控股权的计划已经放缓，原因是估值问题。【原文：Asian private equity firm PAG’s potential sale of its controlling stake in Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd. has slowed down amid valuation concerns following an investigation of Jane Street Group by India’s stock market regulator, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Starlink 就收购 EchoStar 频谱进行深入谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，SpaceX 的 Starlink 公司正在与查理-厄根（Charlie Ergen）的 EchoStar 公司就购买无线频谱进行深入谈判。【原文：SpaceX’s Starlink is in advanced talks to buy wireless spectrum from Charlie Ergen’s EchoStar Corp., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 以色列与印度签署协议加强双边投资
item.description: 以色列和印度两国财政部长在新德里宣布签署双边投资协议。【原文：Israel and India announced the signing of a bilateral investment agreement by their finance ministers in New Delhi.】

item.title: 欧洲央行承诺将 "简单 "SRT 的审批时间缩短至 10 天
item.description: 欧洲中央银行正在寻求缩短其批准某些重大风险转移所需的时间，此举可能会进一步提升这一管理银行资本要求的流行工具的吸引力。【原文：The European Central Bank is seeking to slash the time it needs to approve some significant risk transfers, in a move that could further boost the appeal of a popular tool to manage banks’ capital requirements.】

item.title: 交易商押注美联储加大减息力度，短期国债走势平稳
item.description: 在疲软的美国就业数据提振了降息预期之后，短期国债走高，守住了上周的涨幅。【原文：Short-dated Treasuries edged higher, holding onto last week’s gains after weaker US jobs data boosted expectations for interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国就业再次下滑为美联储减息和劳工统计局批评埋下伏笔
item.description: 截至 3 月份的一年中，美国的就业增长可能远没有政府数据目前显示的那么强劲，这凸显出劳动力市场早在今年夏天招聘放缓之前就已转入低速增长。【原文：US job growth in the year through March was probably far less robust than government figures currently show, underscoring a labor market that shifted into a lower gear well before the hiring slowdown this summer.】

item.title: 明星地位回归，智利债务迎来外国投资浪潮
item.description: 外国投资者正以2017年以来最快的速度涌入智利的地方政府债务，使这个南美国家成为今年新兴市场脱离美元走势的最大赢家之一。【原文：Foreign investors are piling into Chile’s local government debt at the fastest pace since 2017, making the South American nation one of the biggest winners in emerging markets from this year’s move out of the dollar.】

item.title: 华尔街追捧散户交易员为首次公开募股增添动力
item.description: 长期以来被华尔街视为 "傻钱 "的散户交易者，已经改变了从个股、加密货币到单日期权等所有领域的投资态势。现在，他们在首次公开募股（IPO）市场上大显身手，各家公司也张开双臂欢迎他们。【原文：Retail traders, long considered dumb money by Wall Street, have changed investment dynamics in everything from individual stocks to crypto to one-day options. Now they’re throwing their weight around in the IPO market — and companies are welcoming them with open arms.】

item.title: 麦格理资本向 Alvarez & Marsal 寻求潜在 SRT 解决方案
item.description: 麦格理资本（Macquarie Capital）正在考虑首次进行重大风险转移，紧随竞争对手的脚步，着眼于一个蓬勃发展的市场，向投资者分散信贷风险。【原文：Macquarie Capital is considering a debut significant risk transfer, following rivals in looking at a booming market for distributing credit risk with investors.】

item.title: 肯尼亚总统鲁托称债务重组是金融改革的核心
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托（William Ruto）呼吁以更公平的方式重组陷入困境的非洲国家的债务，并在发展援助缩减的情况下改善获得优惠贷款的途径。【原文：Kenyan President William Ruto called for a fairer approach to restructuring the debts of struggling African nations and improved access to concessional lending amid shrinking development aid.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金将在油价震荡中出售美元债券
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金将出售国际债券，以帮助为其大规模投资计划提供资金，因为石油价格的冲击使沙特阿拉伯王国实现经济多元化的努力变得更加复杂。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is set to sell international bonds to help finance its massive investment plans as oil-price shocks complicate the kingdom’s drive to diversify the economy.】

item.title: 美联储或将挽救股市历史上最糟糕的一个月
item.description: 华尔街有一句古老的谚语，说九月是美国股市一年中最糟糕的月份。【原文：An old Wall Street adage — one that happens to be backed by decades of data — says that September is the worst month of the year for the US equity market.】

item.title: 白银借贷成本因关税引发的供应不安而飙升
item.description: 白银租赁价格的飙升再次扰乱了贵金属市场，交易商担心美国可能征收的关税会挤压伦敦本已紧张的供应，因为主要交易中心之间的价格混乱再次出现。【原文：Surging lease rates for silver are once again upending the precious metals market, with traders fearing that possible US tariffs could squeeze already tight supplies in London as price dislocations re-emerge between key trading hubs.】

item.title: 风力发电量将骤降，德国晚间电价飙升
item.description: 由于风速下降意味着将需要更昂贵的燃气发电厂，德国今天傍晚的电价跃升至 12 月以来的最高水平。【原文：German electricity prices for early this evening jumped to their highest level since December as a slump in wind speeds means that more expensive gas-fired plants will be needed.】

item.title: 高盛的科斯汀称美股涨势将扩大至小盘股
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The record-breaking rally in US stocks is set to extend as laggards including small caps play catch-up amid a resilient economic outlook, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 哈格里夫斯-兰斯当（Hargreaves Lansdown）和施罗德（Schroders）向英国储蓄者开放私人基金
item.description: 通过哈格里夫斯-兰斯当公司（Hargreaves Lansdown Plc）与施罗德资本公司（Schroders Capital）之间的合作，英国拥有自我投资个人养老金的零售投资者将首次获得一些私人市场投资的机会。【原文：UK retail investors with self invested personal pensions are to be offered access to some private market investments for the first time through a tie-up between Hargreaves Lansdown Plc and Schroders Capital.】

item.title: 劳工组织称安赛乐米塔尔南非公司必须国有化
item.description: 代表十多个劳工团体的一个机构的领导人表示，南非政府必须对安赛乐米塔尔南非有限公司（ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd. ）进行 "重新国有化"，以避免失业并重建该国陷入困境的制造业。【原文：South Africa’s government must “re-nationalize” ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd. to avert job losses and rebuild the country’s beleaguered manufacturing industry, according to a leader of a body that represents more than a dozen labor groups.】
